items.title: Awesome Amazon Seller
items.content_text:
### Software and Tools

*   [aShop](https://ashop.co) - Effortless microsites for Amazon Sellers. Marketing tool that delivers branded store experience to bring more business and maximize profits.
*   [Prisync](https://prisync.com/) - Price monitoring & tracking SaaS with dynamic pricing and automatching engine.
items.content_html:
Software and Tools

  • aShop - Effortless microsites for Amazon Sellers. Marketing tool that delivers branded store experience to bring more business and maximize profits.
  • Prisync - Price monitoring & tracking SaaS with dynamic pricing and automatching engine.

items.title: Awesome Machine Learning
items.content_text:
### Go / Natural Language Processing

*   [go-ngram (‚≠ê114)](https://github.com/Lazin/go-ngram) - In-memory n-gram index with compression. *\[Deprecated]*
*   [paicehusk (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/Rookii/paicehusk) - Golang implementation of the Paice/Husk Stemming Algorithm. *\[Deprecated]*
*   [go-porterstemmer (‚≠ê191)](https://github.com/reiver/go-porterstemmer) - A native Go clean room implementation of the Porter Stemming algorithm. **\[Deprecated]**

### Go / General-Purpose Machine Learning

*   [birdland (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/rlouf/birdland) - A recommendation library in Go.
*   [leaves (‚≠ê446)](https://github.com/dmitryikh/leaves) - A pure Go implementation of the prediction part of GBRTs, including XGBoost and LightGBM.
*   [go-ml-transpiler](https://github.com/znly/go-ml-transpiler) - An open source Go transpiler for machine learning models.
*   [golearn (‚≠ê9.4k)](https://github.com/sjwhitworth/golearn) - Machine learning for Go.
*   [goml (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/cdipaolo/goml) - Machine learning library written in pure Go.
*   [gorgonia (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/gorgonia/gorgonia) - Deep learning in Go.
*   [therfoo (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/therfoo/therfoo) - An embedded deep learning library for Go.
*   [neat (‚≠ê72)](https://github.com/jinyeom/neat) - Plug-and-play, parallel Go framework for NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT). **\[Deprecated]**
*   [GoNN (‚≠ê364)](https://github.com/fxsjy/gonn) - GoNN is an implementation of Neural Network in Go Language, which includes BPNN, RBF, PCN. **\[Deprecated]**
*   [go-dnn (‚≠ê8)](https://github.com/sudachen/go-dnn) - Deep Neural Networks for Golang (powered by MXNet)

### Go / Spatial analysis and geometry

*   [go-geom (‚≠ê921)](https://github.com/twpayne/go-geom) - Go library to handle geometries.
*   [gogeo (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/golang/geo) - Spherical geometry in Go.

### Go / Data Analysis / Data Visualization

*   [gota (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/go-gota/gota) - Dataframes.
*   [gonum/mat](https://godoc.org/gonum.org/v1/gonum/mat) - A linear algebra package for Go.
*   [gonum/optimize](https://godoc.org/gonum.org/v1/gonum/optimize) - Implementations of optimization algorithms.
*   [gonum/plot](https://godoc.org/gonum.org/v1/plot) - A plotting library.
*   [gonum/stat](https://godoc.org/gonum.org/v1/gonum/stat) - A statistics library.
*   [glot (‚≠ê405)](https://github.com/arafatk/glot) - Glot is a plotting library for Golang built on top of gnuplot.
*   [globe (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/mmcloughlin/globe) - Globe wireframe visualization.
*   [gonum/graph](https://godoc.org/gonum.org/v1/gonum/graph) - General-purpose graph library.
*   [go-graph (‚≠ê94)](https://github.com/StepLg/go-graph) - Graph library for Go/Golang language. **\[Deprecated]**

### Credits / Misc

*   References for Go were mostly cut-and-pasted from [gopherdata (‚≠ê882)](https://github.com/gopherdata/resources/tree/master/tooling)
items.content_html:
Go / Natural Language Processing

  • go-ngram (‚≠ê114) - In-memory n-gram index with compression. [Deprecated]
  • paicehusk (‚≠ê29) - Golang implementation of the Paice/Husk Stemming Algorithm. [Deprecated]
  • go-porterstemmer (‚≠ê191) - A native Go clean room implementation of the Porter Stemming algorithm. [Deprecated]

Go / General-Purpose Machine Learning

  • birdland (‚≠ê46) - A recommendation library in Go.
  • leaves (‚≠ê446) - A pure Go implementation of the prediction part of GBRTs, including XGBoost and LightGBM.
  • go-ml-transpiler - An open source Go transpiler for machine learning models.
  • golearn (‚≠ê9.4k) - Machine learning for Go.
  • goml (‚≠ê1.6k) - Machine learning library written in pure Go.
  • gorgonia (‚≠ê5.8k) - Deep learning in Go.
  • therfoo (‚≠ê18) - An embedded deep learning library for Go.
  • neat (‚≠ê72) - Plug-and-play, parallel Go framework for NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT). [Deprecated]
  • GoNN (‚≠ê364) - GoNN is an implementation of Neural Network in Go Language, which includes BPNN, RBF, PCN. [Deprecated]
  • go-dnn (‚≠ê8) - Deep Neural Networks for Golang (powered by MXNet)

Go / Spatial analysis and geometry

  • go-geom (‚≠ê921) - Go library to handle geometries.
  • gogeo (‚≠ê1.8k) - Spherical geometry in Go.

Go / Data Analysis / Data Visualization

  • gota (‚≠ê3.2k) - Dataframes.
  • gonum/mat - A linear algebra package for Go.
  • gonum/optimize - Implementations of optimization algorithms.
  • gonum/plot - A plotting library.
  • gonum/stat - A statistics library.
  • glot (‚≠ê405) - Glot is a plotting library for Golang built on top of gnuplot.
  • globe (‚≠ê1.6k) - Globe wireframe visualization.
  • gonum/graph - General-purpose graph library.
  • go-graph (‚≠ê94) - Graph library for Go/Golang language. [Deprecated]

Credits / Misc

  • References for Go were mostly cut-and-pasted from gopherdata (‚≠ê882)

items.title: Awesome Composer
items.content_text:
### Plugins / IRC

*   [Composer-Downloads-Plugin (‚≠ê7)](https://github.com/civicrm/composer-downloads-plugin) - Lightweight mechanism to download external resources (ZIP/TAR files) with only a `url` and `path`.

### Setup a Packagist Mirror / IRC

*   [Packagist Mirror (‚≠ê199)](https://github.com/Webysther/packagist-mirror) - This script helps to setup a packagist mirror. It is the maintained and stable version of [Packagist Crawler (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/hirak/packagist-crawler).

### Packagist-compatible repositories / IRC

*   [Firegento](https://packages.firegento.com/) - A Composer Repository providing Magento Modules.
items.content_html:

Setup a Packagist Mirror / IRC

items.title: Awesome Python Data Science
items.content_text: ### Machine Learning / General Purpose Machine Learning * [scikit-learn](http://scikit-learn.org/stable/) - Machine learning in Python. * [xLearn (‚≠ê3.1k)](https://github.com/aksnzhy/xlearn) - High Performance, Easy-to-use, and Scalable Machine Learning Package. * [cuML (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/rapidsai/cuml) - RAPIDS Machine Learning Library. * [modAL (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/cosmic-cortex/modAL) - Modular active learning framework for Python3. * [Sparkit-learn (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/lensacom/sparkit-learn) - PySpark + scikit-learn = Sparkit-learn. * [mlpack (‚≠ê5.4k)](https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack) - A scalable C++ machine learning library (Python bindings). * [MLxtend (‚≠ê5k)](https://github.com/rasbt/mlxtend) - Extension and helper modules for Python's data analysis and machine learning libraries. * [Reproducible Experiment Platform (REP) (‚≠ê696)](https://github.com/yandex/rep) - Machine Learning toolbox for Humans. * [scikit-multilearn (‚≠ê939)](https://github.com/scikit-multilearn/scikit-multilearn) - Multi-label classification for python. * [seqlearn (‚≠ê697)](https://github.com/larsmans/seqlearn) - Sequence classification toolkit for Python. * [pystruct (‚≠ê668)](https://github.com/pystruct/pystruct) - Simple structured learning framework for Python. * [RuleFit (‚≠ê422)](https://github.com/christophM/rulefit) - Implementation of the rulefit. * [metric-learn (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/all-umass/metric-learn) - Metric learning algorithms in Python. * [pyGAM (‚≠ê898)](https://github.com/dswah/pyGAM) - Generalized Additive Models in Python. ### Machine Learning / Ensemble Methods * [ML-Ensemble](http://ml-ensemble.com/) - High performance ensemble learning. * [stacked\_generalization (‚≠ê117)](https://github.com/fukatani/stacked_generalization) - Library for machine learning stacking generalization. * [vecstack (‚≠ê692)](https://github.com/vecxoz/vecstack) - Python package for stacking (machine learning technique). ### Machine Learning / Imbalanced Datasets * [imbalanced-algorithms (‚≠ê239)](https://github.com/dialnd/imbalanced-algorithms) - Python-based implementations of algorithms for learning on imbalanced data. ### Machine Learning / Random Forests * [rpforest (‚≠ê224)](https://github.com/lyst/rpforest) - A forest of random projection trees. * [sklearn-random-bits-forest (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/tmadl/sklearn-random-bits-forest) - Wrapper of the Random Bits Forest program written by (Wang et al., 2016). * [rgf\_python (‚≠ê381)](https://github.com/fukatani/rgf_python) - Python Wrapper of Regularized Greedy Forest. ### Machine Learning / Kernel Methods * [pyFM (‚≠ê926)](https://github.com/coreylynch/pyFM) - Factorization machines in python. * [fastFM (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/ibayer/fastFM) - A library for Factorization Machines. * [tffm (‚≠ê781)](https://github.com/geffy/tffm) - TensorFlow implementation of an arbitrary order Factorization Machine. * [liquidSVM (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/liquidSVM/liquidSVM) - An implementation of SVMs. * [scikit-rvm (‚≠ê238)](https://github.com/JamesRitchie/scikit-rvm) - Relevance Vector Machine implementation using the scikit-learn API. * [ThunderSVM (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/Xtra-Computing/thundersvm) - A fast SVM Library on GPUs and CPUs. ### Deep Learning / PyTorch * [PyTorch (‚≠ê91k)](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch) - Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU acceleration. * [ignite (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/pytorch/ignite) - High-level library to help with training neural networks in PyTorch. ### Deep Learning / TensorFlow * [TensorFlow (‚≠ê191k)](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow) - Computation using data flow graphs for scalable machine learning by Google. * [TensorLayer (‚≠ê7.4k)](https://github.com/zsdonghao/tensorlayer) - Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning Library for Researcher and Engineer. * [TFLearn (‚≠ê9.6k)](https://github.com/tflearn/tflearn) - Deep learning library featuring a higher-level API for TensorFlow. * [Sonnet (‚≠ê9.9k)](https://github.com/deepmind/sonnet) - TensorFlow-based neural network library. * [Polyaxon (‚≠ê3.7k)](https://github.com/polyaxon/polyaxon) - A platform that helps you build, manage and monitor deep learning models. * [tensorflow-upstream (‚≠ê694)](https://github.com/ROCmSoftwarePlatform/tensorflow-upstream) - TensorFlow ROCm port. * [TensorFlow Fold (‚≠ê1.8k)](https://github.com/tensorflow/fold) - Deep learning with dynamic computation graphs in TensorFlow. * [TensorLight (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/bsautermeister/tensorlight) - A high-level framework for TensorFlow. * [Mesh TensorFlow (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/tensorflow/mesh) - Model Parallelism Made Easier. ### Model Explanation / Others * [Alibi (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/SeldonIO/alibi) - Algorithms for monitoring and explaining machine learning models. * [anchor (‚≠ê804)](https://github.com/marcotcr/anchor) - Code for "High-Precision Model-Agnostic Explanations" paper. * [aequitas (‚≠ê725)](https://github.com/dssg/aequitas) - Bias and Fairness Audit Toolkit. * [Contrastive Explanation (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/MarcelRobeer/ContrastiveExplanation) - Contrastive Explanation (Foil Trees). * [yellowbrick (‚≠ê4.4k)](https://github.com/DistrictDataLabs/yellowbrick) - Visual analysis and diagnostic tools to facilitate machine learning model selection. * [scikit-plot (‚≠ê2.4k)](https://github.com/reiinakano/scikit-plot) - An intuitive library to add plotting functionality to scikit-learn objects. * [shap (‚≠ê24k)](https://github.com/slundberg/shap) - A unified approach to explain the output of any machine learning model. * [ELI5 (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/TeamHG-Memex/eli5) - A library for debugging/inspecting machine learning classifiers and explaining their predictions. * [Lime (‚≠ê12k)](https://github.com/marcotcr/lime) - Explaining the predictions of any machine learning classifier. * [FairML (‚≠ê364)](https://github.com/adebayoj/fairml) - FairML is a python toolbox auditing the machine learning models for bias. * [L2X (‚≠ê124)](https://github.com/Jianbo-Lab/L2X) - Code for replicating the experiments in the paper *Learning to Explain: An Information-Theoretic Perspective on Model Interpretation*. * [PDPbox (‚≠ê860)](https://github.com/SauceCat/PDPbox) - Partial dependence plot toolbox. * [PyCEbox (‚≠ê165)](https://github.com/AustinRochford/PyCEbox) - Python Individual Conditional Expectation Plot Toolbox. * [Skater](https://github.com/datascienceinc/Skater) - Python Library for Model Interpretation. * [model-analysis (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/tensorflow/model-analysis) - Model analysis tools for TensorFlow. * [themis-ml (‚≠ê126)](https://github.com/cosmicBboy/themis-ml) - A library that implements fairness-aware machine learning algorithms. * [treeinterpreter (‚≠ê759)](https://github.com/andosa/treeinterpreter) - Interpreting scikit-learn's decision tree and random forest predictions. * [AI Explainability 360 (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/IBM/AIX360) - Interpretability and explainability of data and machine learning models. * [Auralisation (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/keunwoochoi/Auralisation) - Auralisation of learned features in CNN (for audio). * [CapsNet-Visualization (‚≠ê395)](https://github.com/bourdakos1/CapsNet-Visualization) - A visualization of the CapsNet layers to better understand how it works. * [lucid (‚≠ê4.7k)](https://github.com/tensorflow/lucid) - A collection of infrastructure and tools for research in neural network interpretability. * [Netron (‚≠ê31k)](https://github.com/lutzroeder/Netron) - Visualizer for deep learning and machine learning models (no Python code, but visualizes models from most Python Deep Learning frameworks). * [FlashLight](https://github.com/dlguys/flashlight) - Visualization Tool for your NeuralNetwork. ### Genetic Programming / Others * [gplearn (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/trevorstephens/gplearn) - Genetic Programming in Python. * [DEAP (‚≠ê6.1k)](https://github.com/DEAP/deap) - Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python. * [karoo\_gp (‚≠ê164)](https://github.com/kstaats/karoo_gp) - A Genetic Programming platform for Python with GPU support. * [monkeys (‚≠ê125)](https://github.com/hchasestevens/monkeys) - A strongly-typed genetic programming framework for Python. * [sklearn-genetic (‚≠ê322)](https://github.com/manuel-calzolari/sklearn-genetic) - Genetic feature selection module for scikit-learn. ### Optimization / Others * [Spearmint (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/HIPS/Spearmint) - Bayesian optimization. * [BoTorch (‚≠ê3.3k)](https://github.com/pytorch/botorch) - Bayesian optimization in PyTorch. * [SMAC3 (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/automl/SMAC3) - Sequential Model-based Algorithm Configuration. * [Optunity (‚≠ê421)](https://github.com/claesenm/optunity) - Is a library containing various optimizers for hyperparameter tuning. * [hyperopt (‚≠ê7.4k)](https://github.com/hyperopt/hyperopt) - Distributed Asynchronous Hyperparameter Optimization in Python. * [hyperopt-sklearn (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/hyperopt/hyperopt-sklearn) - Hyper-parameter optimization for sklearn. * [sklearn-deap (‚≠ê774)](https://github.com/rsteca/sklearn-deap) - Use evolutionary algorithms instead of gridsearch in scikit-learn. * [sigopt\_sklearn (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/sigopt/sigopt_sklearn) - SigOpt wrappers for scikit-learn methods. * [SafeOpt (‚≠ê147)](https://github.com/befelix/SafeOpt) - Safe Bayesian Optimization. * [scikit-optimize (‚≠ê2.8k)](https://github.com/scikit-optimize/scikit-optimize) - Sequential model-based optimization with a `scipy.optimize` interface. * [Solid (‚≠ê579)](https://github.com/100/Solid) - A comprehensive gradient-free optimization framework written in Python. * [PySwarms (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/ljvmiranda921/pyswarms) - A research toolkit for particle swarm optimization in Python. * [Platypus (‚≠ê615)](https://github.com/Project-Platypus/Platypus) - A Free and Open Source Python Library for Multiobjective Optimization. * [GPflowOpt (‚≠ê272)](https://github.com/GPflow/GPflowOpt) - Bayesian Optimization using GPflow. * [POT (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/rflamary/POT) - Python Optimal Transport library. * [Talos (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/autonomio/talos) - Hyperparameter Optimization for Keras Models. * [nlopt (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/stevengj/nlopt) - Library for nonlinear optimization (global and local, constrained or unconstrained). ### Statistics / NLP * [pandas\_summary (‚≠ê519)](https://github.com/mouradmourafiq/pandas-summary) - Extension to pandas dataframes describe function. * [Pandas Profiling (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling) - Create HTML profiling reports from pandas DataFrame objects. * [scikit-posthocs (‚≠ê369)](https://github.com/maximtrp/scikit-posthocs) - Pairwise Multiple Comparisons Post-hoc Tests. * [Alphalens (‚≠ê3.8k)](https://github.com/quantopian/alphalens) - Performance analysis of predictive (alpha) stock factors. ### Evaluation / Synthetic Data * [recmetrics (‚≠ê579)](https://github.com/statisticianinstilettos/recmetrics) - Library of useful metrics and plots for evaluating recommender systems. * [Metrics (‚≠ê1.6k)](https://github.com/benhamner/Metrics) - Machine learning evaluation metric. ### Computations / Synthetic Data * [numpy](http://www.numpy.org/) - The fundamental package needed for scientific computing with Python. * [Dask (‚≠ê13k)](https://github.com/dask/dask) - Parallel computing with task scheduling. * [bottleneck (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/kwgoodman/bottleneck) - Fast NumPy array functions written in C. * [CuPy (‚≠ê10k)](https://github.com/cupy/cupy) - NumPy-like API accelerated with CUDA. * [scikit-tensor (‚≠ê406)](https://github.com/mnick/scikit-tensor) - Python library for multilinear algebra and tensor factorizations. * [numdifftools (‚≠ê266)](https://github.com/pbrod/numdifftools) - Solve automatic numerical differentiation problems in one or more variables. * [quaternion (‚≠ê637)](https://github.com/moble/quaternion) - Add built-in support for quaternions to numpy. * [adaptive (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/python-adaptive/adaptive) - Tools for adaptive and parallel samping of mathematical functions. ### Spatial Analysis / Synthetic Data * [GeoPandas (‚≠ê4.8k)](https://github.com/geopandas/geopandas) - Python tools for geographic data. * [PySal (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/pysal/pysal) - Python Spatial Analysis Library. ### Quantum Computing / Synthetic Data * [QML (‚≠ê205)](https://github.com/qmlcode/qml) - A Python Toolkit for Quantum Machine Learning. ### Conversion / Synthetic Data * [ONNX (‚≠ê19k)](https://github.com/onnx/onnx) - Open Neural Network Exchange. * [MMdnn (‚≠ê5.8k)](https://github.com/Microsoft/MMdnn) - A set of tools to help users inter-operate among different deep learning frameworks.
items.content_html:
Machine Learning / General Purpose Machine Learning

  • scikit-learn - Machine learning in Python.
  • xLearn (‚≠ê3.1k) - High Performance, Easy-to-use, and Scalable Machine Learning Package.
  • cuML (‚≠ê4.8k) - RAPIDS Machine Learning Library.
  • modAL (‚≠ê2.3k) - Modular active learning framework for Python3.
  • Sparkit-learn (‚≠ê1.2k) - PySpark + scikit-learn = Sparkit-learn.
  • mlpack (‚≠ê5.4k) - A scalable C++ machine learning library (Python bindings).
  • MLxtend (‚≠ê5k) - Extension and helper modules for Python's data analysis and machine learning libraries.
  • Reproducible Experiment Platform (REP) (‚≠ê696) - Machine Learning toolbox for Humans.
  • scikit-multilearn (‚≠ê939) - Multi-label classification for python.
  • seqlearn (‚≠ê697) - Sequence classification toolkit for Python.
  • pystruct (‚≠ê668) - Simple structured learning framework for Python.
  • RuleFit (‚≠ê422) - Implementation of the rulefit.
  • metric-learn (‚≠ê1.4k) - Metric learning algorithms in Python.
  • pyGAM (‚≠ê898) - Generalized Additive Models in Python.

Machine Learning / Ensemble Methods

  • ML-Ensemble - High performance ensemble learning.
  • stacked_generalization (‚≠ê117) - Library for machine learning stacking generalization.
  • vecstack (‚≠ê692) - Python package for stacking (machine learning technique).

Machine Learning / Imbalanced Datasets

  • imbalanced-algorithms (‚≠ê239) - Python-based implementations of algorithms for learning on imbalanced data.

Machine Learning / Random Forests

  • rpforest (‚≠ê224) - A forest of random projection trees.
  • sklearn-random-bits-forest (‚≠ê9) - Wrapper of the Random Bits Forest program written by (Wang et al., 2016).
  • rgf_python (‚≠ê381) - Python Wrapper of Regularized Greedy Forest.

Machine Learning / Kernel Methods

  • pyFM (‚≠ê926) - Factorization machines in python.
  • fastFM (‚≠ê1.1k) - A library for Factorization Machines.
  • tffm (‚≠ê781) - TensorFlow implementation of an arbitrary order Factorization Machine.
  • liquidSVM (‚≠ê67) - An implementation of SVMs.
  • scikit-rvm (‚≠ê238) - Relevance Vector Machine implementation using the scikit-learn API.
  • ThunderSVM (‚≠ê1.6k) - A fast SVM Library on GPUs and CPUs.

Deep Learning / PyTorch

  • PyTorch (‚≠ê91k) - Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU acceleration.
  • ignite (‚≠ê4.7k) - High-level library to help with training neural networks in PyTorch.

Deep Learning / TensorFlow

  • TensorFlow (‚≠ê191k) - Computation using data flow graphs for scalable machine learning by Google.
  • TensorLayer (‚≠ê7.4k) - Deep Learning and Reinforcement Learning Library for Researcher and Engineer.
  • TFLearn (‚≠ê9.6k) - Deep learning library featuring a higher-level API for TensorFlow.
  • Sonnet (‚≠ê9.9k) - TensorFlow-based neural network library.
  • Polyaxon (‚≠ê3.7k) - A platform that helps you build, manage and monitor deep learning models.
  • tensorflow-upstream (‚≠ê694) - TensorFlow ROCm port.
  • TensorFlow Fold (‚≠ê1.8k) - Deep learning with dynamic computation graphs in TensorFlow.
  • TensorLight (‚≠ê11) - A high-level framework for TensorFlow.
  • Mesh TensorFlow (‚≠ê1.6k) - Model Parallelism Made Easier.

Model Explanation / Others

  • Alibi (‚≠ê2.5k) - Algorithms for monitoring and explaining machine learning models.
  • anchor (‚≠ê804) - Code for "High-Precision Model-Agnostic Explanations" paper.
  • aequitas (‚≠ê725) - Bias and Fairness Audit Toolkit.
  • Contrastive Explanation (‚≠ê44) - Contrastive Explanation (Foil Trees).
  • yellowbrick (‚≠ê4.4k) - Visual analysis and diagnostic tools to facilitate machine learning model selection.
  • scikit-plot (‚≠ê2.4k) - An intuitive library to add plotting functionality to scikit-learn objects.
  • shap (‚≠ê24k) - A unified approach to explain the output of any machine learning model.
  • ELI5 (‚≠ê2.8k) - A library for debugging/inspecting machine learning classifiers and explaining their predictions.
  • Lime (‚≠ê12k) - Explaining the predictions of any machine learning classifier.
  • FairML (‚≠ê364) - FairML is a python toolbox auditing the machine learning models for bias.
  • L2X (‚≠ê124) - Code for replicating the experiments in the paper Learning to Explain: An Information-Theoretic Perspective on Model Interpretation.
  • PDPbox (‚≠ê860) - Partial dependence plot toolbox.
  • PyCEbox (‚≠ê165) - Python Individual Conditional Expectation Plot Toolbox.
  • Skater - Python Library for Model Interpretation.
  • model-analysis (‚≠ê1.3k) - Model analysis tools for TensorFlow.
  • themis-ml (‚≠ê126) - A library that implements fairness-aware machine learning algorithms.
  • treeinterpreter (‚≠ê759) - Interpreting scikit-learn's decision tree and random forest predictions.
  • AI Explainability 360 (‚≠ê1.7k) - Interpretability and explainability of data and machine learning models.
  • Auralisation (‚≠ê42) - Auralisation of learned features in CNN (for audio).
  • CapsNet-Visualization (‚≠ê395) - A visualization of the CapsNet layers to better understand how it works.
  • lucid (‚≠ê4.7k) - A collection of infrastructure and tools for research in neural network interpretability.
  • Netron (‚≠ê31k) - Visualizer for deep learning and machine learning models (no Python code, but visualizes models from most Python Deep Learning frameworks).
  • FlashLight - Visualization Tool for your NeuralNetwork.

Genetic Programming / Others

  • gplearn (‚≠ê1.7k) - Genetic Programming in Python.
  • DEAP (‚≠ê6.1k) - Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python.
  • karoo_gp (‚≠ê164) - A Genetic Programming platform for Python with GPU support.
  • monkeys (‚≠ê125) - A strongly-typed genetic programming framework for Python.
  • sklearn-genetic (‚≠ê322) - Genetic feature selection module for scikit-learn.

Optimization / Others

  • Spearmint (‚≠ê1.6k) - Bayesian optimization.
  • BoTorch (‚≠ê3.3k) - Bayesian optimization in PyTorch.
  • SMAC3 (‚≠ê1.2k) - Sequential Model-based Algorithm Configuration.
  • Optunity (‚≠ê421) - Is a library containing various optimizers for hyperparameter tuning.
  • hyperopt (‚≠ê7.4k) - Distributed Asynchronous Hyperparameter Optimization in Python.
  • hyperopt-sklearn (‚≠ê1.6k) - Hyper-parameter optimization for sklearn.
  • sklearn-deap (‚≠ê774) - Use evolutionary algorithms instead of gridsearch in scikit-learn.
  • sigopt_sklearn (‚≠ê75) - SigOpt wrappers for scikit-learn methods.
  • SafeOpt (‚≠ê147) - Safe Bayesian Optimization.
  • scikit-optimize (‚≠ê2.8k) - Sequential model-based optimization with a scipy.optimize interface.
  • Solid (‚≠ê579) - A comprehensive gradient-free optimization framework written in Python.
  • PySwarms (‚≠ê1.3k) - A research toolkit for particle swarm optimization in Python.
  • Platypus (‚≠ê615) - A Free and Open Source Python Library for Multiobjective Optimization.
  • GPflowOpt (‚≠ê272) - Bayesian Optimization using GPflow.
  • POT (‚≠ê2.6k) - Python Optimal Transport library.
  • Talos (‚≠ê1.6k) - Hyperparameter Optimization for Keras Models.
  • nlopt (‚≠ê2.1k) - Library for nonlinear optimization (global and local, constrained or unconstrained).

Statistics / NLP

  • pandas_summary (‚≠ê519) - Extension to pandas dataframes describe function.
  • Pandas Profiling (‚≠ê13k) - Create HTML profiling reports from pandas DataFrame objects.
  • scikit-posthocs (‚≠ê369) - Pairwise Multiple Comparisons Post-hoc Tests.
  • Alphalens (‚≠ê3.8k) - Performance analysis of predictive (alpha) stock factors.

Evaluation / Synthetic Data

  • recmetrics (‚≠ê579) - Library of useful metrics and plots for evaluating recommender systems.
  • Metrics (‚≠ê1.6k) - Machine learning evaluation metric.

Computations / Synthetic Data

  • numpy - The fundamental package needed for scientific computing with Python.
  • Dask (‚≠ê13k) - Parallel computing with task scheduling.
  • bottleneck (‚≠ê1.1k) - Fast NumPy array functions written in C.
  • CuPy (‚≠ê10k) - NumPy-like API accelerated with CUDA.
  • scikit-tensor (‚≠ê406) - Python library for multilinear algebra and tensor factorizations.
  • numdifftools (‚≠ê266) - Solve automatic numerical differentiation problems in one or more variables.
  • quaternion (‚≠ê637) - Add built-in support for quaternions to numpy.
  • adaptive (‚≠ê1.2k) - Tools for adaptive and parallel samping of mathematical functions.

Spatial Analysis / Synthetic Data

  • GeoPandas (‚≠ê4.8k) - Python tools for geographic data.
  • PySal (‚≠ê1.4k) - Python Spatial Analysis Library.

Quantum Computing / Synthetic Data

  • QML (‚≠ê205) - A Python Toolkit for Quantum Machine Learning.

Conversion / Synthetic Data

  • ONNX (‚≠ê19k) - Open Neural Network Exchange.
  • MMdnn (‚≠ê5.8k) - A set of tools to help users inter-operate among different deep learning frameworks.

items.title: Awesome Bioie
items.content_text:
### Journals and Events / Journals

*   [NAR](https://academic.oup.com/nar) - Nucleic Acids Research. Has a broad biomolecular focus but is particularly notable for its annual database issue.

### Tutorials / Pre-LLM Guides, Lectures, and Courses

*   [JensenLab text mining exercises](https://jensenlab.org/training/textmining/)

### Techniques and Models / BERT models

*   ClinicalBERT - Two language models trained on clinical text have similar names. Both are BERT models trained on the text of clinical notes from the MIMIC-III dataset.
    *   [Alsentzer et al Clinical BERT (‚≠ê725)](https://github.com/EmilyAlsentzer/clinicalBERT) - [paper](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/W19-1909/)
    *   [Huang et al ClinicalBERT (‚≠ê421)](https://github.com/kexinhuang12345/clinicalBERT) - [paper](https://arxiv.org/abs/1904.05342)

Techniques and Models / BERT models

  • ClinicalBERT - Two language models trained on clinical text have similar names. Both are BERT models trained on the text of clinical notes from the MIMIC-III dataset.
    • Alsentzer et al Clinical BERT (‚≠ê725) - paper
    • Huang et al ClinicalBERT (‚≠ê421) - paper

Open Source Repos / S3
